intro: Margaritaria hispidula, commonly known as the rough margarita, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is also noted for its ability to tolerate a variety of soil types, making it adaptable to different habitats.
